body:
Knowing your enemy is necessary to fight them effectively.

About ten years ago on reddit a subreddit called ShitRedditSays was created by SomethingAweful users. Its stated goal was to stomp out misogyny and other badthink on reddit. 

Back then reddit was a pretty nice place. Those were the days of Ron Paul and the place was full of techies and libertarians. You could speak your mind in larger subreddits without being instantly banned. Free speech was still something that was universally valued.

The actual goals of SRS were entirely different. Let's say you and a small group of your friends wanted to take down reddit. How would you go about it? A direct attack would surely fail. But there are tactics that work against larger institutions, and that is using the weaknesses of that institution to make it attack itself from within. 

Their tactics included:

 - Coordination outside of reddit
 - Mass reporting of posts and subreddits
 - Coordinating with the media to publish hit pieces
 - Attacking fringe communities
 - False flag attacks: posting content that was illegal or against reddit rules to get subreddits banned
 - Kept lists of users and subreddits to target
 - Worked with reddit admins or had admin sympathizers

I'm sure there were other, more nefarious tactics used, but I haven't witnessed them personally.

They seem to derive pleasure from exercising their power and destroying what others have built. They are the kind of people who find pleasure in destroying another kid's sandcastle rather than building their own.

Other subreddits were created later, like AgainstHateSubreddits, which used similar tactics. 

Partly through their efforts reddit is what it is today.

That brings us to the cabal that has infested ruqqus. It's obvious they are they same people, if not physically, then in spirit. Their stated goal is ridding ruqqus of nazis and other wrongthink (Ruqqus Correction Project). They keep a [list of badthink guilds](https://ruqqus.com/+AgainstChudGuilds/post/372n/how-to-detox-your-feed-a). They seize guilds with the sole purpose of destroying them, as we've seen recently with +HitlerWasRight and others. They coordinate offsite on discord. 

Behind their outwardly "noble" goals of ridding ruqqus of "nazis" is the same desire to destroy. If they are ever successful at getting rid of "nazis" they will just find some other fringe group to attack. They will not stop until ruqqus is dead.

body:
I'll repost my other reply from elsewhere:  

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/comment/l80m/jDC9ApVZFaQ)

This pic is part of the [article I promised to write when I have time](https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/5c4u/resources-on-shill-tactics/kxy4) (still can't finish it, but will soon).  

Basically, they are Antifa/BLM activists IRL, with of few of them possibly being paid.  

The people from the top of a pyramid use their resources (e.g a whole day of "free time", that they're actually paid for) to subvert "natural" communities, then slowly recruit more people who start at the bottom of this pyramid, and is given incentives (praise, other positive reinforcement) to rise through it.

This is far less effective when exposed (hence, this guild exists), but can still only be mitigated to much unless the admins recognize this as well (and they have many reasons to bury their heads in the sand, as I'll explain in the next article after this one).  

All in all, Ruqqus has still not fallen, but is going down a bad path. Now is [a good time to sign up for the Matrix backup](https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/62bp/communication-backup-discord-alternative-matrix-chat).

body:
I agree entirely. I would like to know whether they are being managed by paid shills or whether they are "just trolls". We probably won't have the luxury of knowing. Prepare for the worst but hope for the best, as the saying goes. Either way, I agree with your approach. Exposing what they are doing is the right way to go about it. Other tactics, like infiltration, are possible, if others want to do it.

+HitlerWasRight takeover was a colossal fuckup for them. They moved too soon and it backfired.

The actual goals of SRS were entirely different. Let's say you and a small group of your friends wanted to take down reddit. How would you go about it? A direct attack would surely fail. But there are tactics that work against larger institutions, and that is using the weaknesses of that institution to make it attack itself from within. 

Their tactics included:

 - Coordination outside of reddit
 - Mass reporting of posts and subreddits
 - Coordinating with the media to publish hit pieces
 - Attacking fringe communities
 - False flag attacks: posting content that was illegal or against reddit rules to get subreddits banned
 - Kept lists of users and subreddits to target
 - Worked with reddit admins or had admin sympathizers

I'm sure there were other, more nefarious tactics used, but I haven't witnessed them personally.

They seem to derive pleasure from exercising their power and destroying what others have built. They are the kind of people who find pleasure in destroying another kid's sandcastle rather than building their own.

Other subreddits were created later, like AgainstHateSubreddits, which used similar tactics. 

Partly through their efforts reddit is what it is today.

That brings us to the cabal that has infested ruqqus. It's obvious they are they same people, if not physically, then in spirit. Behind their outwardly "noble" goals of ridding ruqqus of "nazis" is the same desire to destroy. If they are ever successful at getting rid of "nazis" they will just find some other fringe group to attack. They will not stop until ruqqus is dead.

body:
You perceive: you are ostracised because they/he doesn’t like you

Alternate reality: You dissent often, call out what you perceive to be wrong - particularly when it affects others, have your own mind… people like you are not who people like them allow into the group - people who challenge faulty narratives and question motives cannot be indoctrinated, cannot be controlled, disrupt the orthodoxy of the group mind - so they are excluded.

Up to you which one you believe to be true.

body:
I believe the second one in a lot of cases, but many of these times it's from people who share my thoughts. For RCP it turned out not to be, but even then most of those others who are like me were invited.

I don't think it's because they "don't like me". I think it's because I'm a natural failure, and a tryhard and a wannabe. Just look at the people I listed in my bio, who are much less active than me yet easily accomplish multiple times every day more than I've ever been able to in my entire life! (And no, I wasn't born yesterday). And they do so in every area, faultlessly, crushing me even in subjects they've never done before and I've been obsessed with for years. All I'm good for is failing, messing things up, whining, and being annoying.

parent.body:
You perceive: you are ostracised because they/he doesn’t like you

Alternate reality: You dissent often, call out what you perceive to be wrong - particularly when it affects others, have your own mind… people like you are not who people like them allow into the group - people who challenge faulty narratives and question motives cannot be indoctrinated, cannot be controlled, disrupt the orthodoxy of the group mind - so they are excluded.

Up to you which one you believe to be true.

post.body:
Knowing your enemy is necessary to fight them effectively.

About ten years ago on reddit a subreddit called ShitRedditSays was created by SomethingAweful users. Its stated goal was to stomp out misogyny and other badthink on reddit. 

Back then reddit was a pretty nice place. Those were the days of Ron Paul and the place was full of techies and libertarians. You could speak your mind in larger subreddits without being instantly banned. Free speech was still something that was universally valued.

The actual goals of SRS were entirely different. Let's say you and a small group of your friends wanted to take down reddit. How would you go about it? A direct attack would surely fail. But there are tactics that work against larger institutions, and that is using the weaknesses of that institution to make it attack itself from within. 

Their tactics included:

 - Coordination outside of reddit
 - Mass reporting of posts and subreddits
 - Coordinating with the media to publish hit pieces
 - Attacking fringe communities
 - False flag attacks: posting content that was illegal or against reddit rules to get subreddits banned
 - Kept lists of users and subreddits to target
 - Worked with reddit admins or had admin sympathizers

I'm sure there were other, more nefarious tactics used, but I haven't witnessed them personally.

They seem to derive pleasure from exercising their power and destroying what others have built. They are the kind of people who find pleasure in destroying another kid's sandcastle rather than building their own.

Other subreddits were created later, like AgainstHateSubreddits, which used similar tactics. 

Partly through their efforts reddit is what it is today.

That brings us to the cabal that has infested ruqqus. It's obvious they are they same people, if not physically, then in spirit. Their stated goal is ridding ruqqus of nazis and other wrongthink (Ruqqus Correction Project). They keep a [list of badthink guilds](https://ruqqus.com/+AgainstChudGuilds/post/372n/how-to-detox-your-feed-a). They seize guilds with the sole purpose of destroying them, as we've seen recently with +HitlerWasRight and others. They coordinate offsite on discord. 

Behind their outwardly "noble" goals of ridding ruqqus of "nazis" is the same desire to destroy. If they are ever successful at getting rid of "nazis" they will just find some other fringe group to attack. They will not stop until ruqqus is dead.

body:
"Your ability to control your thoughts - treat it with respect. It's all that protects your mind from false perceptions - false to your nature, and that of all rational beings. It's what makes thoughtfulness possible, and affection for other people, and submission to the divine."

~ Marcus Aurelius, Meditations

I think you should remove those people from your bio. There is no one here worthy of that level of idolatry.

body:
Very true. You always have to keep in mind that Reddit didn't turn into the site it is today over night. It happened gradually. With censorship increasing slowly, but surely. 

I only have one guild that is relatively "mild" in comparison right now. But if these people are not stopped, then I will eventually become a victim of these people aswell. "Anti-racists" and "Anti-fascists" usually don't run out of enemies, even if no racists and no fascists are left.

I'll repost my other reply from elsewhere:  

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/comment/l80m/jDC9ApVZFaQ)

This pic is part of the [article I promised to write when I have time](https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/5c4u/resources-on-shill-tactics/kxy4) (still can't finish it, but will soon).  

Basically, they are Antifa/BLM activists IRL, with of few of them possibly being paid.  

The people from the top of a pyramid use their resources (e.g a whole day of "free time", that they're actually paid for) to subvert "natural" communities, then slowly recruit more people who start at the bottom of this pyramid, and is given incentives (praise, other positive reinforcement) to rise through it.

This is far less effective when exposed (hence, this guild exists), but can still only be mitigated to much unless the admins recognize this as well (and they have many reasons to bury their heads in the sand, as I'll explain in the next article after this one).  

All in all, Ruqqus has still not fallen, but is going down a bad path. Now is [a good time to sign up for the Matrix backup](https://ruqqus.com/+ShillWall/post/62bp/communication-backup-discord-alternative-matrix-chat).

About ten years ago on reddit a subreddit called ShitRedditSays was created by SomethingAweful users. Its stated goal was to stomp out misogyny and other badthink on reddit.

Back then reddit was a pretty nice place. Those were the days of Ron Paul and the place was full of techies and libertarians. You could speak your mind in larger subreddits without being instantly banned. Free speech was still something that was universally valued.

The actual goals of SRS were entirely different. Let's say you and a small group of your friends wanted to take down reddit. How would you go about it? A direct attack would surely fail. But there are tactics that work against larger institutions, and that is using the weaknesses of that institution to make it attack itself from within.

Their tactics included:

  • Coordination outside of reddit
  • Mass reporting of posts and subreddits
  • Coordinating with the media to publish hit pieces
  • Attacking fringe communities
  • False flag attacks: posting content that was illegal or against reddit rules to get subreddits banned
  • Kept lists of users and subreddits to target
  • Worked with reddit admins or had admin sympathizers

I'm sure there were other, more nefarious tactics used, but I haven't witnessed them personally.

They seem to derive pleasure from exercising their power and destroying what others have built. They are the kind of people who find pleasure in destroying another kid's sandcastle rather than building their own.

Other subreddits were created later, like AgainstHateSubreddits, which used similar tactics.

Partly through their efforts reddit is what it is today.

That brings us to the cabal that has infested ruqqus. It's obvious they are they same people, if not physically, then in spirit. Their stated goal is ridding ruqqus of nazis and other wrongthink (Ruqqus Correction Project). They keep a list of badthink guilds. They seize guilds with the sole purpose of destroying them, as we've seen recently with +HitlerWasRight and others. They coordinate offsite on discord.

Behind their outwardly "noble" goals of ridding ruqqus of "nazis" is the same desire to destroy. If they are ever successful at getting rid of "nazis" they will just find some other fringe group to attack. They will not stop until ruqqus is dead.
post.title: Know Your Enemy

About ten years ago on reddit a subreddit called ShitRedditSays was created by SomethingAweful users. Its stated goal was to stomp out misogyny and other badthink on reddit.

Back then reddit was a pretty nice place. Those were the days of Ron Paul and the place was full of techies and libertarians. You could speak your mind in larger subreddits without being instantly banned. Free speech was still something that was universally valued.

The actual goals of SRS were entirely different. Let's say you and a small group of your friends wanted to take down reddit. How would you go about it? A direct attack would surely fail. But there are tactics that work against larger institutions, and that is using the weaknesses of that institution to make it attack itself from within.

Their tactics included:

  • Coordination outside of reddit
  • Mass reporting of posts and subreddits
  • Coordinating with the media to publish hit pieces
  • Attacking fringe communities
  • False flag attacks: posting content that was illegal or against reddit rules to get subreddits banned
  • Kept lists of users and subreddits to target
  • Worked with reddit admins or had admin sympathizers

I'm sure there were other, more nefarious tactics used, but I haven't witnessed them personally.

They seem to derive pleasure from exercising their power and destroying what others have built. They are the kind of people who find pleasure in destroying another kid's sandcastle rather than building their own.

Other subreddits were created later, like AgainstHateSubreddits, which used similar tactics.

Partly through their efforts reddit is what it is today.

That brings us to the cabal that has infested ruqqus. It's obvious they are they same people, if not physically, then in spirit. Their stated goal is ridding ruqqus of nazis and other wrongthink (Ruqqus Correction Project). They keep a list of badthink guilds. They seize guilds with the sole purpose of destroying them, as we've seen recently with +HitlerWasRight and others. They coordinate offsite on discord.

Behind their outwardly "noble" goals of ridding ruqqus of "nazis" is the same desire to destroy. If they are ever successful at getting rid of "nazis" they will just find some other fringe group to attack. They will not stop until ruqqus is dead.
post.title: Know Your Enemy

I want to flag all GMs in a post regarding their guilds. It is a protest against admin censorship.
